There are no circular curves or arcs. After sketching, proceed to extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.375 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 1.0 The result is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with the following dimensions: * Width (X-axis): 0.375 units * Length (Y-axis): 0.375 units * Height (Z-axis): 0.375 units Part 2 Instructions Construct a second three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0973, 0.2344, 0.0973] Next, create a sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. There are no circular curves or arcs. After sketching, proceed to extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.1406 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 1.0 The result is a three-dimensional rectangular prism that partially intersects with the first part, with the following dimensions: * Width (X-axis): 0.1805 units * Length (Y-axis): 0.1406 units * Height (Z-axis): 0.1805 units This second part partially merges with the first, joining along their common faces. Final shape The resulting final shape is a rectangular prism made up of the two combined parts. The prism features a flat top and bottom with four parallel sides. This will adjust the size of the prism according to the given dimensions. Step 5: Transform the Sketch into 3D Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector obtained from the coordinate system defined earlier. Step 6: Extrude the Sketch Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.75 units, which corresponds to the height of the prism. Step 7: Complete the Part This part is now complete. The final shape has a length of 0.0013 units, width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.75 units as per the given description. The shape being constructed is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side.</description>
